github.copilot.chat.commitMessageGenerat.text: Generate commit messages strictly following the Conventional Commits format: <type>(<scope>): <description>.
Allowed types: feat, fix, docs, style, refactor, perf, test, build, ci, chore, revert.
Use an optional scope in parentheses to indicate the part of the project affected.
The description must be concise, written in English, imperative mood, and maximum 72 characters.
Do not include emojis, issue numbers, or long explanations in the first line.
If necessary, provide additional context in a body after a blank line, wrapped at 72 characters per line.
If the commit introduces a breaking change, include a BREAKING CHANGE section in the footer.
My branch starts with six characters followed by a hyphen (e.g., M03L07-feature). Always start the commit message with those six characters (e.g., M03L07 - feat(vscode)) .
